headline: Slow Cooker Chili
description: This slow cooker chili is hearty and filling, made with beef, beans, vegetables, and spices, and cooked in the crockpot for an easy weeknight dinner.

video.description: Make this spicy, thick chili in a snap.
video.name: Slow Cooker Chili II

name: Slow Cooker Chili
recipeIngredient: 1 (15 ounce) can kidney beans with liquid
1 (15 ounce) can cannellini beans with liquid

recipeInstructions.text: Place beef in a skillet over medium heat and cook until evenly brown, 8 to 10 minutes. Drain grease.

Transfer beef to a slow cooker and mix in onion, celery, bell pepper, garlic, tomato puree, kidney beans, and cannellini beans. Season with chili powder, salt, basil, oregano, parsley, black pepper, and hot pepper sauce.
Cover and cook on Low for 8 hours.

review.reviewBody: some major changes: 1 pound ground pork, 1 pound ground turkey, 42oz od Kidney Beans, can of Black Beans, one can Cannellini beans, tbls of Chili powder, 1/4 tsp of Chipoltle Chili powder. followed the direction and cooked on low for 8 hrs. It was a nice thick meaty chili. I did add about a cup of water after 4 hours because it looked a little dry. Have plenty for the week. Served with sourcream.
I dont like the fact you use the juice of the two can of beans. Waters down the flavor. I drain them then use some beef stock and some tomato sauce.
I use 28 oz of puree and use ground turkey. Its a favorite.
I liked it because it uses very little canned stuff. Didn't use the bell pepper or celery. Cooked it on high for 4 - 6 hours.
My whole family loved this recipe. I swapped a can of kidney beans for an additional pound of ground beef. I also used 1 whole tablespoon of chili powder. Will definitely make this again!
Added corn.
Needs steak note ground beef

This is pretty tasty but doesn't taste like chili, more like a stew. I made a few changes as others have done. One lb. of meat isn't enough, so I also used one lb. of ground sausage which made it more hearty & added taste. I did not add celery, I added cumin, used fresh parsley & basil instead of dried, and I drained all three cans of beans. Generally a nice taste but not a recipe I'll use again.
The best chili I ever made!! Thank You!!
Good chili. Why the crockpot for 8 hours? Ground beef and beans are already cooked. Assemble in a pot and simmer for half an hour.

i made this as printed, turned out good but not great. Made a few small changes, cooked the beans a little longer to soften them up a bit and added a 50/50 mix of hamburger and ground chicken. added a bit more salt and pepper. gave this dish a great overhaul!! As a note we wanted to get abet more healthy eating and this made a perfict fit
Very tasty. I always use this recipe but bump up the spices. I add cayenne, Paprika, and more chilli powder. I also add chilli peppers or jalopenos, whatever I have on hand.

Weirdly bland, bit watery. Tasted of almost nothing until I added a bunch of salt, then it tasted like it was right out of the can. Not disgusting or anything, just one of the poorer chili recipes I’ve used.
1-30-2021 made for first time.

This is our go to chili and we love it. We have made this recipe of chili probably a dozen times now. As a matter of fact, I have some in the crock pot as I type this up. You will love this chili and it is so easy to make.
My go-to chili recipe. Play with your hot sauce for the final tweak but just a terrific recipe.
Very tasty. I added bell peppers and celery.
This recipe was great. So easy and very flavorful. I had stew meat so I used that instead. I'm probably going to delete my other chili recipes
I followed recipe. Not a chili lover but my kids like chili. Didn't find it had much taste?
Easy to make and very delicious!
I loved it but my husband preferred my old recipe. Will make again and just tell my husband it is the old recipe!

I really like this chili recipe. I skip celery, onion and pepper because of my husband. I made it already 4-5 times. It’s so easy to just put it in the slow cooker in the morning and ready in a couple hours.

This is on regular rotation in my family, I’ve made it a few times so far, and it’s so incredibly easy to prep as a freezer meal, and it is amazing! First time I didn’t have tomato purée, so I used a jar of marinara, and that worked perfectly, but with purée it works just as well. I’ll be keeping this as a permanent recipe and my chili go-to. You can’t beat perfection!
Really great tasting Chili! Fun to make!
I didn't like how pasty it ended up tasting. If I make it again, I'll probably use beef broth or gravy.
Loved this recipe! Used it to make Frito Pies for a baby shower, since Mommy-to-be loves them so much. EVERYONE gave me compliments on the chili! Thank you so much!
This is my favorite chili recipe!! Everyone loves it, even the kids..I usually add more beans than what the recipe calls for and sometimes switch up the tomatoes to Mexican stewed tomatoes
This is a staple at our house. It’s so easy, packed with nutrition, and loaded with flavour.
Best Chili ever! I Made this for the first time ever, ( I barely can boil water). All the guys loved it!!!! I Just made it a little hotter.
Very good, but could use some more spices.

This chili is my absolute go to! Everyone loves it! We like to have it over mashed potatoes!
My edits: 
- I drain all the beans because we like ours a little thicker. 
- I add a bit of cumin.
- Double the hot sauce & add extra chili powder (when the kids aren't home!)
Easy to make, delicious to eat. However, be sure to use cooker liner fo easy cleanup.

This was a nice, easy chili that tastes wonderful. I think it will be even better the second time around. I used my One Pot on slow cooker mode. Still getting used to the One Pot. Think the slow cooker would have meld the flavors even more. I will definitely try this again. It was hearty and very satisfying!!
The best I have been making these for years now!

I was a little disappointed with this recipe. Overly onion-y tasting (perhaps I had a stronger than usual onion?) and this recipe calls for no cumin! The taste was so underwhelming that I ended up adding more chili powder and some cumin.
Great recipe. Next time I will add some heat!
Awesome
Easy and tasty. Would definitely make again.
Mmmm delicious! Put this in the slowcooker before bed. Packed it up for lunch in the morning and admittedly had an early lunch because it smelled so delicious. Will definitely make again.
Nice and simple

I tried this recipe, but found it seemed to be missing something. I couldn’t put my finger on it until I saw other’s comments about cumin missing. Next time I make it I’ll add cumin as well. 
For my first batch, I added a heck of a lot more tobasco sauce just to give it a bit more kick. Also, I used two cans of low sodium diced tomatoes instead of the tomato sauce. I didn’t have cannalini beans, so added black beans. Thanks for sharing. My husband enjoyed what I made (he’s not a chili connoisseur like me.)
A highly appreciated base for slow cooker chili. I add further peppers and spices.

I actually did not use the spices indicated but used 2 packages of McCormick Chili Mix instead. I also doubled the recipe and used 1 lb of ground beef and 1 lb of ground turkey with 2 cans of kidney beans and one can of cannellini beans with 27 oz tomato puree plus 2 15 oz cans of diced tomatoes. I cooked 2 hours on high and 5 hours on low. Delicious!!!

This was absoluteIy the best chili I have ever made! The only change was I added a can of Diced Tomatoes. After watching the video I noticed the vegetables were in larger chunks than I normal chop. The larger pieces made a fantastic difference. Everyone loved it and actually asked me to make it again the following week!
This was the easiest recipe to make, and delicious . Before serving I did a splash of Suraci hot sauce and cheddar with a dollop of sour cream!

Good chili. I added extra garlic along with a lot of chili powder. Next time I’ll add more veggies and cut the beans back. There were a lot in there. I’ll also add in some petite diced tomatoes to give it more texture. Overall, a good base recipe.
A real crowd pleaser. Not too hot- just right for my audience. I did add cumin per other reviews.
Wow this chili with a fresh loaf of sourdough, chili, cheese, sour cream, and tobacco.... FIRE. My girlfriend and I have made this many times.

This is a great recipe for a basic, hearty, kid-friendly chili. I wasn't sure it would be enough flavor with the minimal amounts of seasonings but after simmering for 8 hours in the crockpot it was perfect. Those who want more spice and heat can always doctor it up to taste, but this is a great starter recipe for that!

This was my first chili that I have ever made, so I was looking for a starter recipe that I can build off of. If you want to make this a spicy chili, I suggest adding some cayenne as well. This was definitely a hit at my household though! Thank you!
Did not have as much flavor as I like
I used black beans instead of kidney beans and crushed tomatoes instead of puree, turned out delicious!
Will make this again but will spice it up a bit more next time. Also, my husband found it to have a bit too many beans so I will use one less can.
I loved it! I didn't add cannelloni beans because they don't sell them here (Panama). I also added a little powdered cayenne pepper and some chili flakes for a little more spice.

I went heavier on the seasoning measurement and it was great! Ensuring a small, consistent dice cut for the vegetables made a good difference. Also, using a slow cooker liner made for barely any clean up.
excellent
I enjoyed it the first time I made it. I am making it again for a chili cook off at work. I am going to use sweet peppers instead of green peppers but other than that follow the directions.
MY husband loved this Chili. I did not add the hot sauce as I did not have any on hand. I just added more chili powder and a can of stewed tomatoes. I will surely make this again.

was looking for a good chili recipe since I lost the one that I usually use and I found this one and it was a huge success with my whole family. I made a few changes, I used ground turkey instead of hamburger, I used one can of tomato paste and one can of diced tomatoes instead of the 2 cans of puree and then instead of the cannalli beans I used light kidney beans.... I just made this and my family is already asking me when I am going to make it again

Made it, and everyone loved it! Was for a larger group, so tripled the meat, spices, and tomato purée, while doubling the veggies. Swapped out half the bell peppers for mushrooms, half the celery for carrots, and half the beans I didn't have for an extra can of kidney beans. A1 will make again.

Caveat- 4 stars with modifications, but 2 to 3 without. 

Basically, if you double the amount of seasoning it calls for, and also add some spices that it doesn't call for, it tastes like a darn good chili. If you make this exactly as called for, its way too bland. Don't be afraid to kick up the seasoning!
I mixed a can of rotelle in it and was marvelous

One thing to know about me, I doctor every recipe... I almost tripled the recipe, 2.7 lbs ground beef. I added a&o to the beef while browning. I used one Vidalia onion and two small red onions, because I like the bite of a red onion. I sautéed the onions, celery and garlic for a few minutes, adding a splash of balsamic vinegar to caramelize a bit. Substituted red pepper for green, only because it’s what I had. Used two 28oz cans of San Marzano peeled tomatoes, pureed, with 1/2 tube paste. Added cumin and cayenne to taste (guessed). Even better than anticipated.
I cook for a large family so I added more things to it.

I made this today and tweaked it a bit as per other reviews. I used ground moose, a whole onion, doubled the garlic, doubled the chili powder, added 1 tsp of cumin, a whole tsp of basil/oregano, 2 tsp salt, 1 can of canelli beans, 1 can kidney beans, 1 can of black beans, all drained, a few generous shots of tabasco and a bottle of corona. My husband loved it, which is amazing as he isnt usually a chili lover.
Needs a bit more spice and Maggie
Did a little improvising but stuck to the basics and it was great! Had a football watching party and it was a big success!

We love this recipe but I changed it a little and everyone always wants the “secret” ingredient! Enjoy! Equal amounts chili powder and paprikaBlack and white pepperSauté onions and garlic with beef1 chocolate beer or dark beer with 1/2 T cocoa powder unsweetened

I added Sam's club Gourmet Burger to the ground beef while browning and put 3 bay leaves into the Crock-Pot. Also, beans should never be added to the beginning of a slow cooker recipe. I only added them for 15 minutes at the end in order to avoid mushy beans.
No changes and I will be making it again.
OK chili recipe.
Added frozen corn, black beans, spinach and cauliflower. My husband loves it!
I doubled the spices and used ground turkey. It was great!
Thanks for sharing this solid basic. I preferred cumin and more vegetables.

also added two cans of diced tomatoes with chilies and substituted black beans for cannellini beans
I may add small can of tomato sauce the next time I make it!
Family loves it!

This is the basis for a good recipe but when I made it exactly, it was extremely bland and not very meaty. Weird to see a chili recipe without cumin. I used 1.3 lbs of ground beef and another pound of finely chopped sirloin steak (marketed as "stir fry" steak), doubled most of the spices and added a tablespoon of cumin. My family STILL suggested I throw in a cyan pepper next time.
I added 1/2lb mild Italian sausage, about 3/4 can of tomato sauce, and extra salt and pepper. Best chilli I've ever made!
added some pasta to it and made goulash.
Great for a chilli cook off at work
Me encantó hacer la receta primera vez que la hago
Parsley I substituted Cumin

I actually added 3 pounds of ground beef and swapped a few other different types of beans, added 1 full chopped sweet onion, 1 full green bell pepper. I did not include the liquid of any of the beans except for the chili beans. Once, it's cooking and looking at the texture, I added 1 can of tomato sauce to give it the chili sauce. Made enough for a weeks worth of meals.

I actually added 3 pounds of ground beef and swapped a few other different types of beans, added 1 full chopped sweet onion, 1 full green bell pepper. I did not include the liquid of any of the beans except for the chili beans. Once, it's cooking and looking at the texture, I added 1 can of tomato sauce to give it the chili sauce. Made enough for a weeks worth of meals.

A great “starter” recipe to build on. I upped the amounts of all the vegetables, subbed a can of black beans in for one of the kidney beans and used fresh diced tomatoes. I also added cumin and siracha sauce because it needed a little extra umph.

It's in the crockpot, and it's full. 
I made some slight changes:
I used a package of dried beans. instead of soaking them I used my Instant Pot with 6 cups water. 
I used 2 tsp of chili powder.

This was the blandest chilli I have ever tried. My wife had to doctor this with so much more than the recipe called for just to make it tolerable. I chose this recipe because of the reviews, people need to stop giving 5 stars and then changing everything about it.
This wasn’t *amazing* chili by any stretch but it wasn’t bad either. This is inoffensive to just about everyone.

It was very bland when made as the recipe directed. I would have used chopped canned tomatoes, rather than only sauce, and I needed to add more chili powder as well as some cumin. I even added a few drops of Carolina Reaper sauce, hoping to add some "personality", and I don't even like really spicy food. It worked well enough, but I wouldn't make it again.

I pretty much stuck with the recipe, except I used tomato paste instead of puree. I'm making tonight. The four stars are for the simplicity of the recipe. I love chili and have never attempted to make it on my own, so I'm pretty excited.

Used diced tomatoes and tomato sauce
Added Worcestershire sauce and chipotle cholula sauce 
Sauteed onion garlic and celery 
Browned mix of beef and turkey
This thing was delicious. Beans or no beans. Tried both. Loved both. Tasty.
Perfect chili! My family loved it. I made some Southern cornbread for a side and added some cumin to the recipe. I will be making it again.
I have made this twice. I added 1/4 cup of chili powder when I made this the second time to get more flavour.
Great only changes were green pepper to yellow pepper a lil more salt to taste and hot sauce which was jalepeno sauce found in sauce aisle and that also was add to taste

I made it, and even when I DOUBLED the measurement of spices it was bland AF. Chili for people who are terrified of anything "spicy". But it's convenient crock-pot chili and the ingredients are sound. Just...think of it as a chili base, and add way more spice as you see fit.
As for me, I'll find another recipe that doesn't run screaming from a pepper. ¯\_(?)_/¯
Delicious!
I’ve never ever made a batch of chili that was bad. Until this recipe. It has ZERO flavor. It needed about 5x more chili powder and tomatoes.
Best chili I ever had! Only changes I made were I added lots more chili powder and beef and no celery, the rest I went exactly by recipe. Great chili!
